Text: Conference Call today Cc I can set up a conference bridge for this afternoon at pm Central time if everyone is available Please let Sharon Solon your availability since Im in a training class at pm Thanks Ann Original Message From Porter Gregory J Sent Wednesday October PM To Harris Steven Miller Mary Kay Fossum Drew Pavlou Maria Kirk Steve Frank Kelly Email Steve Stojic Email Kilmer III Robert Cc Smith Ann Subject Indicated Shippers I just received a voice mail from Kathy Edwards attorney for Indicated Shippers She said her clients were not willing to carveout the two issues of competitive bidding and scheduling rights for the Commission to decide as separate policy issues Indicated shippers said both issues have to be a part of a settlement Based on the input I have received from TW thus far Indicated Shippers demands may make a settlement impossible We need to consider whether TW is willing to go further in regard to either or both of the Indicated Shippers positions so far TW has said no Additionally thought should be given to whether appointment of a settlement judge at this time might be helpful I will try to get a call set up to discuss In the mean time any feedback you have would be helpful Greg

SoCalGas Complaint Message from Greg Porter Cc MESSAGE FROM GREG PORTER As you know Transwestern filed a complaint against Southern California Gas Company SoCalGas at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission on September The complaint asked FERC to find SoCalGas refusal to pay the tariff commodity rate constitutes a violation of Transwesterns tariff and the Global Settlement SoCalGas filed an Answer on October In summary SoCalGas Answer stated SoCalGas did not affirmatively agree to pay the stated tariff rate during the Global Settlement The commodity charge SoCal has been paying is consistent with the course of performanceconduct prior to and after the Global Settlement Since the Global Settlement has been in effect SoCalGas has relied on the commodityusage charges that Transwestern has billed SoCalGas claims they had been paying the appropriate rate and that Transwestern failed to include the correct rate in its tariff such omission has created ambiguity and any ambiguity should be construed against the drafter of the tariff Transwestern If the Commission disagrees with SoCalGas and declines to reject the complaint outright any retroactive billing adjustment should be limited to a sixmonth period SoCalGas admits that a retroactive billing adjustment for the escalation factor for six months is reasonable and an escalation factor going forward for the remaining term of its Contract No is appropriate In addition to the foregoing statements SoCalGas provided that it like Transwestern was interested in resolving this matter through ADR Accordingly we will be coordinating with SoCalGas and FERCs ADR group to explore possible ADR procedures We will advise as new developments warrant In the meantime should you have any questions regarding this matter please do not hesitate to contact me at or Maria Pavlou at

TW v SoCalGas Dictation Draft from Greg Porter Cc DICTATION DRAFT FROM GREG PORTER I just spoke with Georgetta Baker lawyer for SoCalGas and Rick Miles FERCs ADR group We discussed the possibility of mediation based upon both parties representing in pleadings filed in Docket No RP TW Complaint that both companies were interested in alternate dispute resolution ADR After discussing the various types of ADR we agreed to begin with mediation Rick Miles will be the mediator The mediation process that was discussed was an evolutionary one whereby parties would meet in a neutral location to discuss resolution ie settlement of its claims Both parties indicated a willingness to settle Rick Miles will act as a facilitator Mr Miles function will be one of moderating discussions and not evaluative As the mediation process continues without resolution Mr Miles role will evolve Later on if the parties desire Mr Miles offered to bring in a FERC staffer that is a subject matter expert to offer his or her views of each partys case Also if the parties desire the subject matter expert would indicate how he or she would recommend the Commission rule on the merits Initial dates of November or November were offered as potential dates for the first meeting A neutral location needs to be agreed upon Once additional information is learned I will advise In the meantime if you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me

Message from Mary Kay Miller Greg Porter re Sublette conference call Cc Mary Kay and Greg would like to discuss with you the Sublette Compressor station enforcement by conference call on Wednesday Oct at am approx minutes Please let me know if you are available Mary Kay and Greg will call each of your offices Thanks Ann for Greg Porter

RE TW FilingBill I will file it electronically and yes FERC actually sends receipts or confirmations Ill send them to you also ann Original Message From Rapp Bill Sent Wednesday November AM To Smith Ann Cc Porter Gregory J Subject TW Filing Ann Attached is the final readytofile Answer of Transwestern Pipeline Company to Protests I believe we have confirmed that this can be filed electronically today If this is not the case please let Steve and me know so that we can have it filed manually Also will we receive any confirmation of receipt of the electronic filing from FERC Thanks File RP AnswerindDdoc

BulletsTony Lee Bill I faxed a copy of last weeks bullets I guess we have to do them today too Please let me know if you have any additions Bill I faxed you Gregs comments to the TW Answer Im faxing you Marias right now Thanks Ann

FERC Filing in RP Notice of Acknowledgement Cc Notice of Acknowledgement The FERCs Office of the Secretary has received the following filing that you submitted Accession File Name CPUCfilingAnswerdoc File Size Filing Date PM File Desc AnswerResponse to a PleadingMotion of Transwestern Pipeline Company under RP Dockets as filed RP Filing Type AnswerResponse to a PleadingMotion Submission Date Time PM Signed by J Gregory Porter Filed by Transwestern Pipeline Company You will receive a subsequent email Notice of Receipt as soon as we convert the file you submitted to the PDF format We will also contact you via email if there is any problem with your electronic submission A third email Notice of Acceptance will be sent once FERCs Office of the Secretary accepts this document as part of the dockets Note The docket numbers you entered for this filing may be changed The Notice of Acceptance email will show the docket numbers assigned by FERC Thank you for participating in FERCs Electronic Filing Program
FilingBill heres the electronic version you requested ann

Message from Greg Porter re Update on Transwestern Pipeline Company vs SoCalGas FERC Proceeding Cc PRIVILEGED CONFIDENTIAL ATTORNEYCLIENT COMMUNICATION FROM GREG PORTER We have agreed with SoCalGas and FERCs ADR group lead by Rick Miles to meet in Chicago on December to begin mediation In anticipation of mediation over the next month we will be meeting to prepare our mediation presentation and discuss potential settlement scenarios and strategies We will have a better sense after the mediation session on December th whether SoCalGas is serious about its desire to resolve this proceeding amicably SoCalGas lawyer has represented to me that they are interested in settlement and prepared at some level to compromise Should you have any questions regarding this matter please do not hesitate to contact me
